metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32743 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
Samba does not validate the Validated-DNS-Host-Name right for thedNSHostName attribute which could permit unprivileged users to write it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
ldb-tools - 2:2.6.1+samba4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:2.6.1+samba4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:2.6.1+samba4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1').
